Package it.polimi.ingsw.model.player

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.network.server.VirtualClient
      • it.polimi.ingsw.model.player.Player
  • public class Player
extends VirtualClient
    The Player is the main actor of the Game.

    • Field Summary

      The number of Executions a player performs on each turn, once final frenzy is activated on said player.

        The number of Damage required in order to declare a player as dead.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • OVERKILL_THRESHOLD

        private static final int OVERKILL_THRESHOLD
        The number of Damage required in order to declare a player as dead, and also overkilled.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        The maximum allowed number of Marks a player can have from the same opponent.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        The number of Executions a player performs on each turn, in standard conditions.

      • EXECUTIONS_PER_TURN_FRENETIC

        private static final int EXECUTIONS_PER_TURN_FRENETIC
        The number of Executions a player performs on each turn, once final frenzy is activated on said player.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MAX_CARDS_IN_HAND

        private static final int MAX_CARDS_IN_HAND
        The maximum number of cards of each type a player is allowed in their hand. This means a player must discard a Weapon as soon as they have more than this threshold, and the same goes for PowerUps.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • remainingExecutions

        private int remainingExecutions
        The number of Executions left to play on the player's current turn.

      • damage

        private java.util.List<Player> damage
        The list of opponents who damaged the player. Each opponent appears as many times as Damage points they inflicted to the player, and in chronological order.

      • markings

        private java.util.List<Player> markings
        The list of opponents who marked the player. Each opponent appears as many times as Marks they dealt to the player, and in chronological order.

      • weapons

        private java.util.List<Weapon> weapons
        The Weapon cards in the player's hand.

        private java.util.List<PowerUp> powerUps
        The PowerUp cards in the player's hand.

        The cell corresponding to the player's current position on the Board.

        The cell corresponding to the player's position on the Board, at the beginning of the current Execution.

        public void causeFrenzy()
        Identifies the player as the first to trigger the final frenzy.

      • getScopes

        public java.util.List<PowerUp> getScopes()
        Returns the list of Scope PowerUps in the player's hand. This is used when checking whether or not the player can add one or more Scopes to an attack, in order to deal additional Damage to their Targets.
        Returns:
        the list of Scope PowerUps in the player's hand.

      • getGrenades

        public java.util.List<PowerUp> getGrenades()
        Returns the list of Grenade PowerUps in the player's hand. This is used when checking whether or not the player can respond to the fire with a tagback Grenade.
        Returns:
        the list of Grenade PowerUps in the player's hand.

      • beginTurn

        public void beginTurn()
        Raises the amount of remaining Executions of the player to the maximum allowed per turn, given the player's conditions.
        See Also:
        EXECUTIONS_PER_TURN, EXECUTIONS_PER_TURN_FRENETIC

      • endExecution

        public void endExecution()
        Decrements the amount of remaining Executions for the player on the current turn.

      • applyDamage

        public void applyDamage​(Player author)
        Inflicts the player with one Damage point.
        Parameters:
        author - the source of that Damage point.

      • applyMarking

        public void applyMarking​(Player author)
        Inflicts the player with one Mark, unless the number of Marks from the same source were to exceed the threshold.
        Parameters:
        author - the source of the Mark.
        See Also:
        MAX_MARKINGS_PER_AUTHOR

      • giveScore

        public void giveScore​(int score)
        Adds a number of points to the player's total score.
        Parameters:
        score - the number of points to add to the current total.

      • scoreDamageTrack

        public void scoreDamageTrack()
        This method is used immediately before respawning and at the end of the Game before the final scoring. The player hands out points to all those opponents they took Damage from, ranked highest to lowest total Damage inflicted. Opponents who dealt no Damage to the player are not considered. Ties are broken in favour of the opponent who damaged the player the earliest. If the player is not on final frenzy, the opponent who dealt the very first Damage point is awarded one extra point.
        See Also:
        ScoreList

      • die

        public void die()
        Increments the player's death count and removes them from the Board (in order to allow for the respawning mechanic to take place).

      • spawn

        public void spawn​(Cell cell)
        Clears the Damage track of the player and sets them on a SpawnCell.
        Parameters:
        cell - the spawnpoint chosen for the respawn.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Creates a string containing a short description of the player.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the string.
